BQX.definition: Proprietary momentum indicator consisting of ask, bid, and mid values
BQX.purpose: Primary target for prediction AND feature for autoregressive modeling
BQX.paradigm_shift: BQX values can now be used as BOTH features AND targets (since 2024-11-24)

Interval_Centric.definition: All calculations use row-based windows (ROWS BETWEEN) instead of time-based
Interval_Centric.rationale: Ensures consistent sample sizes regardless of data gaps
Interval_Centric.implementation: ROWS BETWEEN N PRECEDING AND CURRENT ROW
Interval_Centric.forbidden: Any time-based windows (e.g., INTERVAL, date arithmetic)

Independent_Models.definition: Each currency pair has its own isolated model
Independent_Models.isolation: Complete - no feature or data sharing between pairs
Independent_Models.rationale: Each pair has unique dynamics requiring specialized modeling

Feature_Target_Separation.old_rule: BQX values strictly prohibited as features
Feature_Target_Separation.new_rule: BQX values can be features (lags) AND targets (forward predictions)

terminology.Lag: Historical value N bars ago (e.g., close_lag_1, bqx_mid_lag_1)
terminology.Lead: Future value N bars ahead (e.g., bqx_mid_lead_1)
terminology.Regime: Market state categorization (trending, ranging, volatile, calm)
terminology.Centric: Calculation perspective (tick, bar, order, trade, position, portfolio)
terminology.Cell_Type: Unique combination of feature × centric × variant (96 total)
terminology.Table: BigQuery table containing specific feature set for a currency pair
terminology.Stage: Project plan stage in AirTable (70 total)
terminology.Phase: Project plan phase in AirTable (11 total)
